supercontext.mission: Give contributors quick context when they land in orders/ directories by adding lightweight README pointers.

goal: Add concise README files to docs/orders/ and docs/archive/orders/ that explain how to use the directories, where to find archived orders, and how to add new ones.
execution_instructions: Keep the README text short (≤150 words each) and link to existing guidance instead of duplicating long sections.
Follow repository tone and formatting conventions (heading, bullet list for key actions).
If a README already exists, extend it rather than replacing; otherwise create a new file.

steps: Create docs/orders/README.md with an overview, instructions for drafting new orders (link to example-order-template.json), and a reminder to archive completed orders.
Reference docs/orders/order-archival-001.json and docs/reports/archive_audit.md so future agents know where archival guidance lives.

tasks.description: Ensure docs/archive/orders/README.md reflects the new flow.
steps: Review the existing README and add a short section describing how archived orders should cite their completion evidence.
Link back to docs/orders/README.md so users can jump between active and archived guidance.

acceptance_criteria: docs/orders/README.md exists with overview, template pointer, and archival reminder.
docs/archive/orders/README.md mentions the archival log/report locations and cross-links back to docs/orders/README.md.
README text stays succinct and does not duplicate long instructions already documented elsewhere.

what_not_to_do: Do not duplicate large sections from README.md or AGENTS.md; link instead.
Do not introduce directory-specific scripts or automation in this order—documentation only.
Do not remove historical notes from docs/archive/orders/README.md.
